resources.string: Suppose you had $100 in a savings account and the interest rate was 2 percent per year. How much money would you have in the account at the end of first year?
Suppose you need to borrow $100. Which of the following(s) is the lower amount to pay back?
Suppose you had $100 in a savings account and the interest rate was 2 percent per year. How much money would you have in the account after five years if you did not remove any money from the account?
Imagine that the interest rate on your savings account was 1 percent per year and inflation was 2 percent per year. After 1 year, how much would you be able to buy with the money in this account?
Suppose you have some money. Is it safer to put your money into one business or investment, or to put your money into multiple businesses or investments?
